Author: Mr Bob
Review: This quiet little temple complex would be easy to overlook but you would find the short walk getting here well worth the effort. I visited many temples during Golden Week but I was most impressed with the simplicity and natural beauty of this place. The surrounding gardens are well laid out and not over tended. So many places have swarms of workers really overdoing the groundskeeping. This garden is in great condition but not overdone and very natural looking.

Author: Hsing Fan
Review:
The best place for maple leaves watching.
It's quiet, peaceful and when you walk to the top you can actually overlook the whole Kyoto city.
Entrance fee is ¬•400 per person. Totally worthy.

Author: Erin Noxon
Review: What a gorgeous hidden gem! Called the Green Maple, there are so many colors of green that you can't name them all. The Moss is so gorgeous and I can't wait to go in the fall to see the maples when they change color! Such a beautiful place, just off the beaten path. I can't believe I left the super crowded main street and there was hardly anyone here. Perfect place to feel at peace... And what a great view!

Author: J Teoh
Review: Jojakko-ji Temple is a quaint temple on the main Arashiyama tourist route that offers a chance to escape the crowds that swarms the area. A good little enclave to explore before heading to the forest.

Author: Joffrey F
Review: Serene, off the beaten path. A nice break from the crowd

Author: Jack Poon
Review: Very nice and harmonious garden with plenty of photographic subjects. The red maple leaves would have been gorgeous here. Be prepare to do some climbing.

Author: Xiangchuan Kong
Review: To me probably the best place I visited in Kyoto. The temple is quite, no mass tourists, a place you can really enjoy yourself and find peace.

Author: Luca Cortese
Review: Amazing temple in Arashiyama, one of the best in the area, in my humble opinion. And it‚Äôs very close to bamboo grove and Okochi Sanso Villa Gardens. These pictures have been taken in late October 2017, too early for Autumn foliage sadly.

Author: Thomas C
Review: A very picturesque shrine with good foliage. The stairs leading up to the temple are one of its most photographed scenes. The main drawback here is it's highly trafficked -- in fact the most of the dozens I've been to in Kyoto. It was very difficult to take any kind of photos here without people obstructing you.

Author: Daniel Lim
Review: Way Better than expected. The highlight here is small section of bamboo with autumn color background. I don‚Äôt think one can get photos with such setting elsewhere! Plenty of fall colors that would put you in awe. Not many people, may be it was rain. Love it!

Author: Kristy
Review: What a treat to go during the fall! Easily the best place to view Kyoto's fall foliage, yet this temple isn't well cited in many travel guides. Easily our favorite place we visited in Arashiyama district. You can get a great view of the city by climbing up to the vista point.

Author: Ëµ§Áéâ
Review: About 15min to Hankyu Arashiyama station

Author: Jun Zh
Review: A place to settle down our busy mind‚ô•Ô∏è

Author: Tom Ashworth
Review: Beautiful! Much more peaceful than Tenryu-ji.

Author: lex
Review: Definitely underated attraction spot. Its still beautiful eventhough the period i went cherry blossom period already end. By far the most beautiful temple i went in Japan, if u like natural, thn this is place for u

Author: Bart Claeys
Review: Peaceful area with a temple on top from which you get a nice view over Kyoto (walk beyond the temple, a bit higher). Great stop to escape the crowds, enjoy the silence, hear the birds and frogs. Cost: 500 yen. Plus, there is free Wi-Fi üòÄ and convenient free bike parking.

Author: Xian Jie Lee (XJ)
Review: Jojakko-in is a good place to get away from the crowds at the bamboo forest. Its gardens are brilliant-green with moss in the summer and there are toads croaking in the tiny pond at the top. It‚Äôs well worth the admission fee of ¬•500.

Author: YJ C
Review:
If you only do one temple in Kyoto, this is the one to go to.
On a rainy September morning at 10am, I was nearly the only person wandering the grounds, so I had the viewpoint at the top all to myself. This is probably closer to how temples are meant to be experienced, than as part of a never ending crowd.
Incredible greens on the mossy hills and so many trees sprawling over the stone steps - how can anyone not find this beautiful?

Author: Ben Hsu
Review:
The temple has beautiful garden and moss on the ground. The maple leaf season of the temple is around late October to mid November, and it is very crowded especially in weekend.  Temple is not extraordinarily large, but its garden is extraordinarily excellent and has high reputation among local Japanese and Japanese garden designers for its moss, tree garden, and fall maple leave beauty.

While temple has very beautiful garden, the temple does not have much religious worship or chatting practice.  It appears that the temple is selling its garden as a tour attraction, and visitors can enjoy garden beauty with serenity.

It takes about 20 minutes of walking distance from Arashiyama Randen train station to the temple, and most popular route is to walk through famous Arashiyama Bamboo Gloves trails.

The temple does not have handicapped access or parking, because the temple was built on mountain slope and requires moderate mountain steps climbing.  However, visitors have options to climb up mountain steps straight line directly or go up on "Z" shape step climbing, which is more suitable for the seniors.

The temple does have toilets, but no vending machine or gift shop selling any drink.  Although there's a coffee shop near the temple, it does not open on some weekdays. Thus, visitors should prepare for or bring their own drinking water, especially in summer and other hot days.

Author: Muhammad Hazmi Anas
Review: No word to describe. Too beautiful. With only 500Yen you can enjoy the amazing view. Just 10 min from the tourist place bamboo path.

Author: Roanna K
Review: Amazingly quiet, peaceful, not crowded (currently) temple where you can sit and experience the Japanese sense of wabi-sabi beauty. Also has a nice view of Kyoto through the trees!

Author: Jaess Chin
Review: Beautiful place!!! Especially during autumn period. Nice place for those who love the maple leaf.

Author: Nick Beckers
Review: Nice temple grounds, I really recommend to go to the top for a beautiful view of Kyoto.

Author: fairus rahim
Review: Beautiful temple. Especially during fall/autumn. A perfect place to snap a photo. Also its near the arashiyama bamboo forest. My top list of the most beautiful temple when i was in kyoto. Hope the gov or people there can preserve and look after the places for many generation to come.

Author: Darshan Karkar
Review: There's a small entrance fee (500 yen), but it's totally worth the price. It's a beautiful Temple where you can easily spend an hour going down different paths to see different buildings.

Author: Trinh Le
Review: Yesterday we visited Jojakkoji Temple in Arashiyama and was blown away by its serene beauty. The temple was not far from the Bamboo Grove, but you could hardly see any big group of tourists. Even though it‚Äôs a popular autumn foliage watching spot, the sakura trees in the temple ground are just as gorgeous, and if you climb all the way to the hilltop, you‚Äôll have a very good view of the city.

Author: Herry Dai
Review: Quite beautiful temple. Need close to an hour to fully explore. Some climbing required. Definitely appreciate the quietness compared to other busy tourist spots.

Author: Julian Bharadwaj
Review: Nice and small temple - I paid 1000 yen per adult. Ended up spending 20 minutes in here checking out the grounds and meditating for a bit. It does get crowded as the day goes by - so, the earlier you can come in (after they open of course), the better. Some nice views.

Author: Kyla Hewson
Review: Found this place unexpectedly, but it was worth the entry fee and very beautiful

Author: Chris Hewson
Review: A wonderfully quiet spot past the arashiyama bamboo grove. The admittance fee of 500¬• is worth it for everything you get to see. It doesn't take too long to walk around all the temple grounds but it is a very peaceful place if you wanted to sit and relax. There are bathrooms here as well.

Author: Radames Cintra
Review: The place is very beautiful and peaceful. Ideally try to get there by the time it opens around 9am. It is a good extension to the bamboo forest walk. There are a few steps to get to the top, but it is a very mild exercise. At the top of the temple there is a lookout in which you can see the city. It costs 500 Yen's for adults, 200 for children.

Author: Marika
Review: Amazing place ...I don't have words to describe it....you must go and see it

Author: „É≠„ÉúËòøËîî
Review: Perfect Temple with perfect scenic that you can see all of Arashiyama region when walking the highest point. The plantscaping here is also great when visiting in different seasons.

Author: Andrea L
Review: My favorite temple in the area. Beautiful grounds and Japanese maples that probably look incredible in the autumn. I hear there is a black cat that wanders the property but it was sleeping at the entrance booth the day I visited

Author: RJ Hill
Review: A true paradise worth visiting. Be sure to walk to the highest point to get one of the best views of Kyoto. It is tranquil and serene and the garden has some very interesting flowers in spring/summer.

Author: P K
Review:
Quiet, peaceful, beautiful, I wouldn‚Äôt mind walking around more. Some stairs but it‚Äôs an easy climb. Best viewed in the fall, when the leaves changes color.
Travel Date: Mid May, Monday at 12-1pm
Popularity: Few people

Author: Dr. Anthony J. ‚ÄúQuantum Minister‚Äù Toledo
Review: Beautiful temple with a nice view of the city.

Author: Y P
Review: Small and peaceful temple with beautiful garden. There are few steps to the top where you can have a nice view of the town.

Author: Tee F Kay
Review: A very beautiful temple embedded in a wonderfully made and maintained park landscape. When you get the winding ways up to the top you will have a nice view over the green Arashiyama.

Author: ping yong
Review: not main attraction of Arashiyama area, the name of the temple means "always quiet", very serenity & tranquil. great place to enjoy autumn red maple tree..

Author: Kelvin Morrison
Review: Very pretty place and great exercise.   The middle of summer might not be the best time to visit but it is very pretty and historic.   Please note that there is no food or drinking there so make sure you are plenty refreshed before you start having a wander through.

Author: kitz kirti
Review: It was a full of adventure as well as history involved in it....nuce time spent there...lots of buddhist learning...huge temples....very well maintained cleanliness slient meditation place highly recommended for people who are religious ....great garden great view...

Author: Luke North
Review: Great view at the top! Its very peaceful.

Author: Marjorie Lasson
Review: Off the tourist roads, a peaceful and very pleasant place. The view from their observatory is amazing. We were alone to enjoy the whole place!

Author: Yuri Okada
Review: Beautiful and serene! It‚Äôs one of the most popular (and best) spots to capture the autumn foliage and admire the colourful leafs so it can get busy but it‚Äôs still worth a visit

Author: Mel N
Review: My absolute favourite temple so far. So serene, shady and such beautiful foliage. I went when everything was so lush and green. Make sure you get to the top for views over the city and mountains in the distance. The temple also has wifi and a resident cat.

Author: Matƒõj Melichar
Review: Beautiful walk through the garden of the temple located in forest in the hillside.

Author: Josephine E.
Review: Stunning temple with a wonderful view over Arashiyama. Very beautiful, especially in autumn when the maple leaves change colour.

Author: Sunchai N
Review: Nice temple in Asashirama area. Must visit.

Author: Green Lining
Review: Peaceful place to stroll through, away from the crowds of the bamboo forest (which is made underwhelming purely because of the hordes of western tourists). It's a welcome break to enter the serenity of this temple. The walk up to the top is more than worth it for a breathtaking view of Kyoto.

Author: Rebecca
Review: This is by far the best temple visit I've made in my entire Kyoto trip. I was a bit hesitant going in at first coz it didn't look very grand, as compared to the bigger temples, but I'm so glad I went. Everything here is covered with moss, and it looks so green and beautiful. There is this blanket of silence and tranquility the moment you step inside. It was incredibly relaxing and it felt like I was in another world. The city seems so far away. If you climb all the way to the top of the steps, you have this bird's-eye view of Arashiyama. The toilet is clean and also has WiFi, lol.

Author: Dhaval Jani
Review: Felt really good and beautiful place to visit

Author: Gino Pascual
Review: A nice place to visit during the fall part of the year when the leaves are changing and a good place to see the bamboo forest. Be sure to have shoes that are slightly suited for hiking so it makes it easier to walk around.

Author: Stacey Roseman
Review: This Temple was amazing! Beautiful view and so peaceful. Worth a visit if you are in Kyoto.

Author: Eva Br√§nnstr√∂m
Review: Gorgeous, green and a lot calmer than some of the other shrines in the area. There's a lovely view of Kyoto at the top of the area.

Author: Alison Bernezat
Review:
Peaceful with lots of little spots to rest and enjoy the scenery.
Bonus kitty : Kurobe-chan üòª

Author: Emily Luckett
Review: Incredible fall colors right now. Very crowded at 10am.

Author: Ralph Manning
Review: Stunningly beautiful but incredibly busy. Don't expect to get any zen atmosphere when the whole world is there taking selfies, but if you can look past that its a worthwhile trip.

Author: Eric Woo
Review: Amazing during late November - the colours are nothing I have ever seen before. I had to turn the saturation on my photos for the first time.

Author: Jocelyn Chiao
Review: Beautiful red leaves season

Author: Rattikorn Pinta
Review: This is my favorite top 1 temple in Arashiyama. I would recommend everyone to come here rather than Tenryuji temple which is very crowded and small.

Author: Brian Lin
Review: Great temple for Autumn leaves. There were quite some people here, but still manageable. The line was not super long, maybe a 10-minute of wait before you are in.

Author: Camaris Faircloth
Review: This temple is really cool, there are actually like 6 buildings onsite. One of my favorites of my trip so far. Not accessible for impaired as it is all up hill, but it‚Äôs honestly not very far, maybe 5 minutes walk to the top if you didn‚Äôt stop. There is moss, towers, gates, temples, and bamboo so it is kind of an all in one

Author: Richard E
Review:
This Temple is a 15-20 min walk from the more popular Bamboo forest in Kyoto, but is well worth the visit!!

Would be helpful to have a guide or someone with you to explain the history of this very old temple and old grave area, it also has a smaller bamboo forest to see. Small entrance fee, but very worth to visit.

Author: Alex C
Review: Beautiful autumn foliage, koyomi. We didn‚Äôt pay to get in but the exterior is beautiful enough. Just a few minutes walk from bamboo forest and Torokko Arashiyama train station (Sagano Line)

Author: Markus Maga
Review:
Nice temple on the outskirts of town! Top of the temple area has a nice view over town.

Can be combined with various parks and views nearby, like the bamboo forest.

Author: Cam Kirk
Review: Not another soul in this place when we visited. We wandered around in total silence, it was incredibly peaceful compared to the chaos of the surrounding temples and shrines. Up in the back hills of the temple, it also has a small viewing garden with beautiful views of the Kyoto valley.

Author: Gaudre T
Review: absolutely relaxing place with a wonderful views!

Author: Fuyumi Namioka
Review: The silence that reigns this small "Pure land of wisdom" temple, a little jewel in the Saga-no, a beautiful countryside of Kyoto, from which you can enjoy a awesome Kyoto view. It's a pure joy stopping and contemplating in it's garden. Although the temple is small, you can walk inside to visit the small pavilions and sutra scattered here and there on its property.

Author: Hiroki Kobayashi
Review: Red and Green contrast is magically beautiful owing to here‚Äôs chill and hot temperatures. Highly recommended.

Author: saki yamamuro
Review: Peaceful temple with beautiful garden

Author: Jean-Fran√ßois Bergeon
Review: Been living in Kyoto for few years already, and J≈çjakk≈ç-ji has become one of my favorite temple to enjoy Á¥ÖËëâ (Autumn leaves).

Author: Wong Al
Review: This is a must-go temple. It's really crowded even on weekdays. I can spend hours in there taking pictures and enjoying the view.

Author: Prima Shariff
Review: A hidden gem in Kyoto. Beautiful place to see autumn leaves without the crazy crowds. It‚Äôs far out from the main Arashiyama area, and the trek is a bit long, but so worth it. If you climb to the top, you get a nice panoramic view of the city.

Author: Êùë‰∏äÈ°ï
Review: from JRsaga-arashiyama , about 15 minutes walk carry you this temple . green autumn leaves and moss are waiting for you with some beautiful halls . slopes are a little hard but the view from the upper side makes you be happy .

Author: Rory Rosszell
Review: If you turn to the right at the end of the path through the bamboo forest, and walk for maybe ten minutes (we were on bikes), you will come to this beautiful little gem. Very quiet and peaceful, with great views of the area.

Author: Dania Guerrero
Review: Cute little Buddhist temple! Very serene and peaceful. Beautiful fall colors (Nov 11).

Author: Ka Rin
Review:
This one honestly was not our favorite, despite the perfect timing for autumn leaves. The garden doesn't manage the visitor stream that well, so people crowded rather small areas taking pictures of other peoples' backs.
Wouldn't recommend coming here.

Author: „Ç∏„Ç®„Éº„É†„Çπ
Review: Wow, gorgeous in Autumn but also quite crowded with many visitors. Pictures from November 23.

Author: Miguel Moraes Vaz
Review: Beautiful temple. Such an amazing view as you start walking up. You pay 500 yen as an entry fee but it‚Äôs totally worth the money.

Author: Darren Soshi
Review: I really enjoyed visiting this temple. Beautiful surroundings, and very peaceful. Good entry price. And lots of things to photograph. Worth your time going to visit if you are in the area

Author: Julia Chinn
Review: In early November before peak foliage but the moss garden already lost its summery green? this temple was just okay. We much prefer nearby Okochi Sancho which has a beautiful garden and similar grand view of the city.

Author: tigerlily
Review: So much maple leaves!! Beautiful and small temple

Author: Sherry Tsai
Review:
Kyoto has lots of temples!
Glad I can in maples seasonüíïüíï
Love views and peaceful üôèüèª

Author: Chloe Lee
Review: Quite and peaceful

Author: boorachat J
Review: I visited here in the second week of december 2022. It all turns red. The temple give me the vibe of peaceful as it was very cold, quiet and all maple red. Let walk to this little moutain. Very easy to walk from the bamboo forest just 10 mins

Author: Dan P
Review:
The most green I‚Äôve ever seen!

This shrine is an homage to the colour green; it‚Äôs serene and provides stacks of solitude.

There‚Äôs a couple of small climbs dotted with small shrines; until you reach the Zenith and its vista.

As you‚Äôre walking around Arashiyama you could easily miss this beauty; and you‚Äôll regret it because it‚Äôs sans crowds!

Author: DeanReviews
Review:
Absolutely worth the JPY 500 entry fee. Visited in February. Arashiyama and the bamboo forest were heaving with tourists, however this area was completely serene and peaceful. Only about 5 other people in there.

A fair bit to walk around, including some steps. Beautiful pagodas and temples, some bamboo areas around the edges too.

Some parts were under construction but this didn‚Äôt take away from the experience. Great even in winter but I imagine it‚Äôs incredibly beautiful in spring or autumn.

The bell is rung many times just before midday, which was cool to see.

Author: Paul Ng
Review: quiet and less people go there

Author: Emma
Review: This was my favourite spot in all of Arashiyama. A very peaceful and tranquil temple complex, with so much to see and admire. There is a beautiful garden, covered in moss. My favourite part was the climb to the viewing platform to see stunning views of the surrounding countryside. I could have stayed all day looking at the incredible nature and relishing the sounds. I highly recommend this place for some solitude and tranquility.

Author: Erivan
Review: Beautiful  Buddhist temple in a serene forest and views.

Author: Bj√∂rn Ebner
Review: Maybe the best attraction this area has to offer (which is not much). I liked it!

Author: Adriano Caruso
Review: Absolutely worth the 500 yen entry fee. Super nice lady at the front as well. There is so much history and greenery that the more time you spend there the more relaxed you will be.

Author: Erwin Abel
Review: This temple and its grounds are absolutely amazing. We went there on a rainy morning, which just added to the atmosphere. Given how busy everything else was in the area, there was almost nobody there. Very peaceful and quiet with little temples spread along a hillside walk through the forest. Great views of Kyoto as well. I rate this place much higher then any of the more famous and incredibly busy temples in Kyoto.

Author: M Kraidi
Review: Great stop for pictures.

Author: F. S√∂ding
Review: Very very beautiful garden complex. Escape from the crowds of arashiyama.

Author: Harriet Fisher
Review: Quiet temple with not many visitors. Gardens are more natural grounds with moss covered areas and bamboo.

Author: Ponpoje Porapakkarm
Review: beautiful thick japanese moss carpet in the garden

Author: Mike Kwong
Review: Very scenic

Author: Ada Smith
Review: Peaceful and active local temple in a beautiful and natural setting.
